alert.note: Alert for Clay; East Becker; East Marshall; East Otter Tail; East Polk; Grant; Hubbard; Kittson; Lake Of The Woods; Mahnomen; Norman; North Beltrami; North Clearwater; Pennington; Red Lake; Roseau; South Beltrami; South Clearwater; Wadena; West Becker; West Marshall; West Otter Tail; West Polk; Wilkin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 20 at 1:31PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...AN ACTIVE MID TO LATE WEEK PERIOD... Dangerously cold wind chills from 25 below to 50 below zero will continue tonight through Sunday. Overall, the lowest values should be in the Devils Lake region, with slightly better conditions east of the Red River Valley in Minnesota. Another round of light snow will move through the area Wednesday into Wednesday night. This event would bring 1 to 2 inches of snow to areas along and north of highway 2, and 2 to 5 inches of snow for areas to the south. Most of the higher end amounts should occur along the North and South Dakota border into west central Minnesota. Patchy blowing and drifting snow is possible in open country along and west of the Red River Valley from Thursday through Saturday. However, the period of strongest winds now looks to be Friday. On the positive side, no new snowfall is expected during this period, so that would not add to the blowing and drifting snow issue. There is still uncertainty in the exact strength of these winds on Friday, so the probability for ground blizzard conditions along and west of the Valley remains at about 20 percent. Even if the really strong winds do not materialize Friday, getting stuck during this frigid stretch is life threatening. Finally, there is a potential for a clipper system on Sunday. Traditionally, clippers are not large snow producers, but it could bring another few inches of snow on a busy travel day. For those traveling this week, make sure to check the latest forecasts and road conditions, and carry a winter survival kit in your vehicle.
